body_html: I think this might be the averaging - PyTorch uses "nats per target character" akin to the bpc metric commonly seen for character rnns, Sean might divide by the input length. Heuristically, you should scale down the learning rate to compensate for the change in error scale unless your optimizer normalizes out the scale. It might be more appropriate to discuss on the forum, though.
